description.narrative: Access and quality of PSE are increased through improved legal framework, diversified programmes and services and intersectoral cooperation aiming at improving equity., which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased percentage of vulnerable children and adolescents participating in relevant, quality and inclusive pre-university education with improved learning outcomes and competences

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Access and quality of PSE are increased through improved legal framework, diversified programmes and services and intersectoralcooperation aiming at improving equity.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support national efforts to reform preschool education (PSE), focusing on increasing quality and equity, by subsector development and building resilience to emergency situations. Implementation of the new preschool curriculum was the entry point for comprehensive reforms that will improve access, quality, and equity in early childhood education to ensure that every child learns. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2020

title.narrative: PSI included into capacity building programme for new PSE curriculum(62639)
